int range_lock ( struct range_lock_tree *  tree,
struct range_lock *  lock 
)

Lock a region.

Parameters:
tree [in] range lock tree
lock [in] range lock node containing the region span
Return values:
0 get the range lock
<0 error code while not getting the range lock

If there exists overlapping range lock, the new lock will wait and retry, if later it find that it is not the chosen one to wake up, it wait again.

__u64  start,
__u64  end 
)

Intialize a range lock node.

Parameters:
lock [in] an empty range lock node
start [in] start of the covering region
end [in] end of the covering region

Pre: Caller should have allocated the range lock node. Post: The range lock node is meant to cover [start, end] region

Initialize a range lock tree.

Parameters:
tree [in] an empty range lock tree

Pre: Caller should have allocated the range lock tree. Post: The range lock tree is ready to function.

Definition at line 47 of file range_lock.c.

References range_lock_tree::rlt_lock, range_lock_tree::rlt_root, and range_lock_tree::rlt_sequence.

Referenced by ll_lli_init().

void range_unlock ( struct range_lock_tree *  tree,
struct range_lock *  lock 
)

Unlock a range lock, wake up locks blocked by this lock.

Parameters:
tree [in] range lock tree
lock [in] range lock to be deleted

If this lock has been granted, relase it; if not, just delete it from the tree or the same region lock list. Wake up those locks only blocked by this lock through range_unlock_cb().
